'''Atheromatous renal artery stenosis:'''

* Elderly subjects with several cardiovascular risk factors, including pre-existing hypertension. This develops into :
** hypertension resistant to triple therapy including a diuretic;
** causing flash PAO
** deterioration in renal function on ACE inhibitors or ARBs2 ;
** chronic renal failure in cases of bilateral stenosis (ischaemic nephropathy).


'''Fibrodysplasia of the renal artery:'''

* Newly discovered hypertension, sometimes severe and symptomatic;
* sometimes associated with hypokalaemia and metabolic alkalosis (secondary hyperaldosteronism).

question.title: What are the two main causes of renal artery stenosis?

option_a.title: Atherosclerosis and hypertension
option_a.description: A common cause of renal artery stenosis in elderly subjects with cardiovascular risk factors

option_b.title: Fibroplastic and atherosclerosis
option_b.description: A possible cause of renal artery stenosis, but not as common as atheromatous stenosis

option_c.title: Renal artery stenosis and hypertension
option_c.description: A condition characterized by high blood pressure and narrowing of the renal artery

option_d.title: Fibromuscular dysplasia and atherosclerosis
option_d.description: A rare cause of renal artery stenosis, often associated with secondary hyperaldosteronism
